title: how can I effectively use my 4 months gap between 12th and sem 1 of btech
content:
im done with all my competitive exams, now I have around 4 months of free time in hand. regardless of what college I get into (say i get into PES itself), taking a mental break -relaxing during holidays apart. what should I be doing during these 4 months. anything specific that will come in handy as soon as college starts, maybe certain skills?(like communication skills etc, or even technical skills) 
I'm just a workoholic and I don't want to waste 4 months doing nothing but play video games and end up regretting later. so if someone can suggest me helpful activities id be really greatful.

Answering this as a grad:

# Enjoy the last summer vacation of your life.

I cannot stress on that enough. Once you begin college, you are going to miss the annual summer breaks. And once you are out of college, you don't really have a summer break anymore. I'd suggest to relax, do whatever you would like to do and give your mind and body a break. College is a whole new chapter and a pretty big step up in life. It is not going to be like school. Its best to just relax for now and tick things off your bucket list lol. 

You don't need any prep or study to start college, just an open mind ready for the new experience.

However if you absolute *want* to do something and you are looking at CS/ECE branches, I would highly recommend doing [MIT's missing semester course](https://missing.csail.mit.edu/).

1) i would suggest waking up at 6 am. then remember that you don't need to study anymore, so go to sleep and acually wake up at noon. 

2) get up brush your teeth and then (this is very important) eat some shit and either watch tv or play some video games. after a couple hours, glance over to your nearest clock and notice that the time is 12 am. 

3) check your calendar, if the day is not the first day of college, go to sleep. if it is the first day of college, cry and then go to sleep. 

4) repeat steps 1,2,3 until it is the first day of college
